intro: Anthistiria imberbis var. vulgaris, commonly known as the common anthistiria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are typically finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or along stream banks.
